column4: hi to all in this room, i need help with my driver graphic card, how can i know if i have the 2D driver in my PC?
no, im a noob :S sorry for my actitud :S all check that soon hold on
ok ... type "glxinfo" (without quotes) in a terminal window
it show me a big list :S but i dont understand what dos means :S, but u think that i have the 2D driver if i just changed the driver
it should filter the answer and it will display if you have any 3D accelerator driver workign
here is the result of the 2 commando that u give me http://paste.ubuntu.com/250958/
what graphic card do you have?

when i installed ubuntu 9.04 the screen was really slow because the driver was Vesa, so i correct that problem and changed to the correct driver that the driver is a openchrome. tha card is a VIA Technologies, Inc. CN896/VN896/P4M900 [Chrome 9 HC] (rev 01)
i have not experience with this card your using ... did u check their website for proper linux drivers?

of yes. right now im in one here that is telling me about 2D driver to install it. but i would like to know if i alreally have the 2D driver. i can install the 3D becuase the speed of my card is a 256mb :S
ohhh, i thought you wanted 3D acceleration, sorry
well, at least it says you have direct rendering and OpenGL .... so i think you're fine
jajaja it ok :) ohhh ok thanks :)
